message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the taste of glucose. Glucose is a type of sugar and is known to have a sweet taste. Therefore, when glucose is present in food, it can make the food taste like candy, which is sweet. Option (A) is incorrect because glucose does not have a direct effect on the wetness of food. Option (C) is also incorrect because glucose does not have a direct effect on the dryness of food. Option (D) is unrelated to the taste of glucose, as glucose does not cause food to taste hot.
